materials.raw_text: Erbium (Er): 10 g, Indium (In): 5 g, Thulium (Tm): 15 g, Zinc (Zn): 20 g

sourcing.instructions: Erbium: Rare earth metal suppliers or online chemical distributors. Indium: Metal suppliers or electronics components distributors. Thulium: Rare earth metal suppliers. Zinc: Hardware stores or chemical suppliers.
steps: Erbium: Rare earth metal suppliers or online chemical distributors. Indium: Metal suppliers or electronics components distributors. Thulium: Rare earth metal suppliers. Zinc: Hardware stores or chemical suppliers.

1. Measure 10 g of Erbium, 5 g of Indium, 15 g of Thulium, and 20 g of Zinc using a digital scale. 2. Place all measured metals in a clean, dry crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the metals to ensure a homogeneous mixture. 4. Mix thoroughly to achieve an even distribution of all elements.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 10 g of Erbium, 5 g of Indium, 15 g of Thulium, and 20 g of Zinc using a digital scale. 2. Place all measured metals in a clean, dry crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to finely grind the metals to ensure a homogeneous mixture. 4. Mix thoroughly to achieve an even distribution of all elements.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 800°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 800°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent oxidation of the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25°C). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has fully cooled to prevent oxidation of the material.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified alloy from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to shape the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to remove any sharp points and achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a clear sealant to protect the surface from oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified alloy from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to shape the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to remove any sharp points and achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a clear sealant to protect the surface from oxidation.
